'Cetyl alcohol', also known as '1-hexadecanol' and 'palmityl alcohol', is a
fatty alcohol with the formula CH 3(CH 2) 15 OH. At
room temperature, cetyl alcohol takes the form of a waxy white solid or flakes.
The name 'cetyl' derives from the whale oil () from which it was first
isolated.
